resource.description: The NCBI Taxonomy database contains the names of all organisms that are represented in the Entrez genetic databases.
Gene Ontology annotation uses evidence codes to indicate the type of evidence that supports the annotation.
The Gene Ontology (GO) project provides a controlled vocabulary to describe gene and gene product attributes in any organism.
InterPro is a database of protein families, domains and functional sites in which identifiable features found in known proteins can be applied to unknown protein sequences.
Dehalococcoides ethenogenes (Green nonsulfur bacteria) strain GENERAL
Treponema pallidum (Spirochetes) strain subsp. pallidum str. Nichols
Chlorobium tepidum (Green sulfur bacteria) strain TLS
Bacillus anthracis Ames (Gram-positive, Firmicutes) strain Ames
Francisella tularensis (gamma-proteobacteria) strain subsp. tularensis SCHU S4 (first published such species genome in Nature Genetics)
Yersinia pestis (gamma-proteobacteria) strain CO-92 (first published in Nature in 2001)
Shigella flexneri (gamma-proteobacteria) strain 2a str. 301 (first published in NAR 2002)
Salmonella typhi / Salmonella enterica (gamma-proteobacteria) strain sv Typhi CT18 (2001 Nature)
Staphylococcus aureus (Gram-positive, Firmicutes) strain subsp. Aureus Mu50
Vibrio cholerae (gamma-proteobacteria) strain N16961, Biotype ElTor (2000 Nature)
Listeria monocytogenes (Gram-positive, Firmicutes) strain EGD-e (first published in Science 2001)
Campylobacter jejuni (epsilon-proteobacteria) strain subsp. jejuni NCTC 11168 (first published in Nature 2000)
Streptococcus pneumoniae (Gram-positive, Firmicutes) strain TIGR4 (second published Streptococcus, but published in Science 2001)
Clostridium perfringens (Gram-positive, Firmicutes) strain 13 (first published cpe genome)
Rickettsia typhi (alpha-proteobacteria) strain Wilmington (PATRIC REFERENCE GENOME)

resource.displayName: Brucella suis/Brucella melitensis bv suis Proteins (GenBank)
resource.description: Brucella suis/Brucella melitensis bv suis (alpha-proteobacteria) strain 1330 (PATRIC REFERENCE GENOME)
Coxiella burnetii (gamma-proteobacteria) strain RSA 493 (PATRIC REFERENCE GENOME)
Entamoeba histolytica (PROTOZOA-ENTAMOEBIDAE intestinal parasite and the causative agent of amoebiasis)
Dictyostelium discoideum (PROTOZOA-MYCETOZOA social amoebae, slime mold)
Theileria annulata (PROTOZOA-APICOMPLEXA) strain Ankara clone C9
Trypanosoma cruzi (PROTOZOA-EUGLENOZOA) strain CL Brener TC3
Saccharomyces cerevisiae (FUNGI, budding yeast) strain S288C
Neurospora crassa (FUNGI, filamentous fungus) strain OR74A
Cyanidioschyzon merolae (PLANTS, red algae PROTOZOA-RHODOPHYTA ) strain 10D
Oryza sativa (PLANTS, rice) strain ssp. Indica or ssp. Japonica

resource.wgetArg: --post-data='query=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><!DOCTYPE Query><Query virtualSchemaName="default" header="1" count="" softwareVersion="0.5"><Dataset name="dmelanogaster_gene_ensembl" interface="default"><Attribute name="description" /><Attribute name="family" /><Attribute name="gene_stable_id" /><Attribute name="translation_stable_id" /><Attribute name="peptide" /><Filter name="biotype" value="protein_coding" /></Dataset></Query>'
